name: Diclofenac Potassium

indications.text: diclofenac potassium capsules indicated relief mild moderate acute pain adult pediatric patients 12 years age older . ( 1 )

contraindications.text: lowest effective shortest duration consistent individual patient treatment goals ( 2.1 ) 25 mg four times day

warningsAndPrecautions: diclofenac potassium capsules 25 mg , translucent , pale yellow , liquid-filled capsules printed `` 25 `` black ink supplied : ndc number 72336-432-12 bottles 120 capsules storage store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protect moisture light . dispense tight , light resistant container defined usp .
adverseReactions: diclofenac potassium capsules contraindicated following patients : known hypersensitivity ( e.g . , anaphylactic serious skin ) diclofenac components product [ ( 5.7 , 5.9 ) ] history asthma , urticaria , allergic-type taking aspirin nsaids . severe , sometimes fatal , anaphylactic nsaids reported patients [ ( 5.7 , 5.8 ) ] setting coronary artery bypass graft ( cabg ) surgery [ ( 5.1 ) ] diclofenac potassium capsules contains gelatin contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity bovine protein .
indications_original: Diclofenac Potassium Capsules are indicated for relief of mild to moderate acute pain in adult and pediatric patients 12 years of age and older. (1)
contraindications_original: Use the lowest effective dosage for shortest duration consistent with individual patient treatment goals ( 2.1 ) The dosage is 25 mg four times a day
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Diclofenac Potassium Capsules 25 mg, are translucent, pale yellow, liquid-filled capsules printed with "25" in black ink supplied as:
                  NDC Number 72336-432-12                    Bottles of 120 Capsules
                  
                     Storage 
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursions permitted between 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Protect from moisture and light. Dispense in a tight, light resistant container as defined in USP.
adverseReactions_original:
Diclofenac Potassium Capsules are contraindicated in the following patients:
                  
                     Known hypersensitivity (e.g., anaphylactic reactions and serious skin reactions) to diclofenac or any components of the drug product [see Warnings and Precautions (5.7, 5.9)]
                     History of asthma, urticaria, or other allergic-type reactions after taking aspirin or other NSAIDs. Severe, sometimes fatal, anaphylactic reactions to NSAIDs have been reported in such patients[see Warnings and Precautions (5.7, 5.8)]
                     In the setting of coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)]
                     Diclofenac Potassium Capsules contains gelatin and is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to bovine protein.
